newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PPC sees drop in half year eps.
newsitem.headline: PPC sees drop in half year eps.

text.p: South African cement firm Pretoria Portland Cement Ltd said on Thursday that its half year earnings per share were likely to be "slightly down" due to a higher effective tax rate and more shares in issue.

"Earnings per share at the half year are expected to be slightly down on last year due to a higher effective tax rate and an increase in the number of shares in issue," chairman Warren Clewlow said in a trading statement.
For the six months to March 31, 1996, the firm posted an earnings per share of 226.6 cents.
At 1100 GMT PPC shares were down 100 cents to 68.00 rand.
But the group added first quarter sales volumes and operating profits are in line with company expectations and that the full year outlook was still good.
"We expect a satisfactory growth in earnings," Clewlow said. -- Johannesburg newsroom +27 11 482 1003
